attributes.PROJECT_FULL_TITLE: Hydrogen interconnector Spain  France [currently known as BarMar]
attributes.TECHNICAL_DESCR:
The Hydrogen Interconnector Spain – France [currently known as BarMar] aims at interconnecting future hydrogen infrastructure between Spain and France through an offshore hydrogen pipeline.

The project concerns the following infrastructure:

  • New compressor station in Barcelona with capacity of 144 MW
  • New offshore interconnector Barcelona-Marseille consisting of approximately 455 km pipeline with a 700-1050 mm diameter.

The project will enable the transport of 2 Mt/y of hydrogen and contributes to the emergence of one of the major hydrogen import corridors via the Mediterranean Sea identified in the REPowerEU plan.
attributes.IMPLEMENTATION_STATUS_DESCR: Planned but not yet in permitting
attributes.PROMOTERS: Teréga SA (FR) ; GRTgaz SA (FR) ; Enagás Infraestructuras de Hidrógeno (ES)
